item.title: Re-designation of Asad Aijaz as Secretary to Government in J&K - Cross Town News
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: BPSC Row: Supporters Of Pappu Yadav Burn Tyres, Block Roads In Bihar - News18
item.description:
Protest Erupts in Bihar as Pappu Yadav's Supporters Demand BPSC Exam Cancellation

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: News18

Independent MP Pappu Yadav’s supporters protested in Patna, calling for the cancellation and re-examination of the Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) exam.

  • Protesters burned tyres and blocked roads in a demonstration against the BPSC.
  • Pappu Yadav has called for a statewide 'Bihar Bandh' today.
  • This protest follows long-standing demands from aspirants regarding irregularities in the BPSC exam held on December 13, 2024.
“There is no strength bigger than people’s strength.” - Prashant Kishor

As tensions escalated, police detained some protesters. The ongoing protests reflect broader issues surrounding the integrity of the BPSC exams and the concerns raised by candidates.

item.title: ‘People in Maharashtra showed Sharad Pawar, Uddhav Thackeray their place’: Amit Shah’s dig over poll results - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Amit Shah Criticizes Sharad Pawar and Uddhav Thackeray After Maharashtra Poll Results

Publication Date: Jan 12, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Union Home Minister Amit Shah took a dig at Sharad Pawar and Uddhav Thackeray, stating that the recent Maharashtra assembly election results clearly showed them their place in the political landscape.

  • Shah emphasized that the results rejected the politics of dynasty and betrayal.
  • The BJP-led Mahayuti alliance secured a historic 233 seats in the assembly elections.
  • The Congress-led MVA won only 16 seats, while Thackeray's Shiv Sena secured 20 and Pawar’s NCP just 10.
“People in Maharashtra showed that Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena is Balasaheb's Shiv Sena.”

Shah expressed confidence in winning upcoming elections and remarked that the opposition's confidence has been shaken by the defeat in Maharashtra.

item.title: Swapping trains at Katra will ensure safety: CM Omar Abdullah - Greater Kashmir
item.description:
Safety Measures for Passengers at Katra Railway Station, Says CM Omar Abdullah

Date: January 12, 2023 | Source: Kashmir News Observer

Chief Minister Omar Abdullah emphasized the importance of passenger safety, supporting the practice of swapping trains at Katra railway station to address security concerns.

  • Omar Abdullah stated that security of passengers is a priority.
  • He believes people should accept train swapping at Katra if it enhances safety.
  • The Chief Minister discussed the ski slopes in Gulmarg and the potential for tourism in areas like Sonamarg.
  • He announced plans for a new convention center in Gulmarg to attract international events.
  • The long-awaited Z-Morh Tunnel will improve connectivity for local residents and travelers.
“At the end of the day, safety must come first,” said Omar Abdullah.

The Chief Minister's remarks highlight the ongoing efforts to ensure passenger safety while promoting tourism and infrastructure development in the region.

item.title: 'Victory in Maharashtra stopped betrayal politics of Sharad Pawar, Uddhav Thackeray': Amit Shah's big att - The Times of India
item.description:
Victory in Maharashtra stopped betrayal politics of Sharad Pawar, Uddhav Thackeray: Amit Shah's big attack on MVA

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Amit Shah delivered a pointed critique of the current Maharashtra government, asserting that their victory signifies a halt to the deceptive politics previously observed.

  • Shah claims the MVA alliance betrays public trust.
  • Highlights the need for accountability within Maharashtra's political framework.
  • Sets the stage for upcoming electoral challenges.
“Maharashtra has decided to reject betrayal politics,” said Amit Shah during his speech.

This statement marks a significant moment in the ongoing political narrative of Maharashtra as it addresses issues of integrity and public trust in leadership.

item.title: NEET PG 2024: MCC round 3 counselling deadline extended - The Indian Express
item.description:
NEET PG 2024: MCC round 3 counselling deadline extended

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

The Medical Counselling Committee (MCC) has announced an extension for the choice filling and locking window for round three of NEET PG counselling, now set to end on January 16 by 8 am.

  • The final seat allotment list is scheduled for release on January 18.
  • Eligible candidates can register for PG medical colleges by January 15.
  • Reporting and joining at allotted colleges will occur between January 18 and January 25.
  • The cut-off percentile has been reduced, with new eligibility criteria for various categories in place.
“The general and EWS category students scoring 15 percentile and above will be eligible to participate in the counselling.”

The MCC's revised schedule aims to accommodate students impacted by the new percentile cut-offs.

item.title: Ramesh Bidhuri refutes AAP's 'BJP CM face' claim: 'Arvind Kejriwal accepted...' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ramesh Bidhuri refutes AAP's 'BJP CM face' claim: 'Arvind Kejriwal accepted...'

Date: Jan 12, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Ramesh Bidhuri, the BJP candidate for the Kalkaji assembly seat, has rejected Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Arvind Kejriwal's assertion that he would be the chief ministerial face of the BJP, calling it misleading propaganda.

  • Bidhuri emphasizes his loyalty to the BJP and clarity about not seeking any post.
  • Kejriwal’s claim implied that BJP would win the upcoming Delhi assembly elections.
  • Bidhuri mentions public dissatisfaction with Kejriwal’s governance, citing several scams and issues faced by the people of Delhi.
  • Kejriwal challenged Bidhuri to a public debate regarding his candidacy for CM.
  • The Delhi assembly election is scheduled for February 5, 2025, with results on February 8.
"The party has given me a lot, I have no claim for any post. Arvind Kejriwal has continuously started misleading propaganda against me." - Ramesh Bidhuri

In conclusion, Ramesh Bidhuri calls for support for the BJP, aiming to reassure the citizens of Delhi of his dedication and intent.

item.title: 'Baseless to refer me as BJP's CM face': Ramesh Bidhuri slams Arvind Kejriwal over 'misleading propaganda - The Times of India
item.description:
Baseless to refer me as BJP's CM face: Ramesh Bidhuri slams Arvind Kejriwal over misleading propaganda

Publication Date: [Date Not Available] Source: [Source Not Available]

Ramesh Bidhuri has publicly refuted claims made by Arvind Kejriwal, labeling them as misleading propaganda. Bidhuri stated that it is unfounded to refer to him as the BJP's Chief Ministerial candidate.

  • Bidhuri denies being the BJP's candidate for CM.
  • Accuses Kejriwal of spreading misleading information.
  • The political rivalry between BJP and AAP intensifies.
Bidhuri remarked, "It is baseless to refer to me in such a context."

Bidhuri's strong stance underscores the ongoing political tensions in the region.

item.title: ISRO SpaDeX Docking Mission Live Updates: In trial attempt at docking, SpaDeX satellites successfully come 3 meters to each other, says ISRO - The Indian Express
item.description:
ISRO SpaDeX Docking Mission Live Updates

Date: April 2023 | Source: Indian Express

In a recent trial attempt, the ISRO conducted a successful maneuver with its SpaDeX satellites, bringing them as close as 3 meters to one another. This experiment is a crucial step towards demonstrating in-space docking.

  • The SpaDeX mission aims to demonstrate in-space docking using small spacecraft.
  • If successful, India will become the fourth nation capable of this technology, joining the US, Russia, and China.
  • The mission is significant for future projects, including lunar missions and establishing a space station by 2035.
  • ISRO emphasizes caution due to the complexity of docking moving satellites.
“Since this is just a technology demonstration mission, getting it right is more important that getting it done on schedule.”

The SpaDeX mission is an important step for ISRO as it develops its capabilities for future space exploration endeavors.

item.title: 'Vivekananda said young generation will find solution to all problems, have absolute faith in him': PM Mo - The Times of India
item.description:
PM Modi Highlights Faith in Youth's Problem-Solving Abilities Inspired by Vivekananda

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Various news outlets

Prime Minister Modi emphasized that the younger generation possesses the capacity to tackle various challenges by drawing inspiration from Swami Vivekananda.

  • PM Modi expressed confidence in the youth's problem-solving skills.
  • He referenced Vivekananda's teachings as a guide for the younger generation.
  • The statement aims to inspire and encourage youth involvement in societal issues.
"Young generation will find solutions to all problems, have absolute faith in him."

This message serves to motivate the youth and highlight the importance of their role in shaping the future.

item.title: Developed nation is achievable with the strength of India’s youth: PM Modi - Hindustan Times
item.description:
PM Modi Emphasizes Youth's Role in Achieving a Developed India

Date & Source: Jan 12, 2025, Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed the Viksit Bharat Young Leaders Dialogue 2025, emphasizing the critical role of India's youth in transforming the nation into a developed country over the next 25 years.

  • Modi highlighted Swami Vivekananda's faith in the potential of Indian youth.
  • The event marked National Youth Day and had 3,000 participants aged 15 to 29.
  • Modi shared anecdotes illustrating his trust in youth and their capabilities.
  • He mentioned the G-20 Summit and its significance for India's future.
  • A book titled 'Yuva Shakti’s Vision for Viksit Bharat @ 2047' was released during the event.
“I firmly believe that with the strength of India’s youth, the dream of a developed nation is achievable.” - PM Modi

In conclusion, Modi's optimism and vision for India's youth are pivotal in steering the nation towards development.

item.title: ‘Quite shocking’: Shashi Tharoor slams Nitesh Rane on EVM remark - The Indian Express
item.description:
‘Quite shocking’: Shashi Tharoor slams Nitesh Rane on EVM remark

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

Congress MP Shashi Tharoor condemned Maharashtra Minister Nitesh Rane's remarks about EVMs, calling them 'quite shocking' and emphasizing the need for equality and unity in India.

  • Tharoor reacted negatively to Rane's statement equating EVMs with anti-Muslim sentiment.
  • He highlighted the historical lessons from India's freedom struggle about religious equality.
  • Rane's comments drew criticism for targeting specific communities.
“This kind of thing is quite shocking... We are all equal individual citizens of India.” - Shashi Tharoor

Tharoor insists that the principles of equality must remain central to India's identity as a nation.

item.title: Torres fraud: Ukrainian masterminds fled India under garb of Christmas leave - The Indian Express
item.description:
Ukrainian Masterminds of Torres Fraud Scheme Escape on Christmas Leave

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 Source: Indian Express

Two Ukrainian women, suspected masterminds of a significant fraud case, fled India under the guise of taking Christmas leave, prompting an investigation by the Mumbai police Economic Offences Wing (EOW).

  • The women were identified as Victoriia Kovalenko and Olena Stoian, directors of Platinum Hern Pvt Ltd, which operates the Torres jewellery brand.
  • Three additional individuals were arrested in connection with the Torres Ponzi scheme, with a substantial amount of cash seized.
  • An internal conflict at the Torres Dadar store exposed financial irregularities that led to widespread investor concern, gathering about 600 investors outside the store.
  • Ongoing investigations are looking into possible connections to other fraud cases in Turkey.
“Internal fights exposed the collapse of the company,” said a source involved in the investigation.

This case underscores the risks in investment schemes and the need for due diligence among investors.

item.title: Military Digest | ‘Army is the servant of people…exists to defend democracy’: remembering General Cariappa’s legacy - The Indian Express
item.description:
‘Army is the servant of people…exists to defend democracy’: remembering General Cariappa’s legacy

Publication Date: January 12, 2023 Source: Indian Express

This article commemorates Army Day and reflects on the legacy of General K M Cariappa, the first Indian general and commander-in-chief of the Indian Army. It highlights his emphasis on the army's role in defending democracy and serving the people.

  • Army Day is observed in memory of General K M Cariappa, who became commander-in-chief on January 15, 1949.
  • General Cariappa stated, “The Army is the servant of the people and it exists to defend democracy and protect…”
  • He advocated for discipline and moral integrity within the army as custodians of taxpayer-funded resources.
  • Introduced voluntary military training for civilians to instill a sense of discipline among the public.
  • The training proposal included physical training and sanitation talks but was not approved by the political establishment.
“Remember the Army, and everything in it, is the property of the taxpayer.” – General K M Cariappa

In conclusion, General Cariappa's vision for a disciplined army that serves the public remains relevant, although some of his training proposals faced political resistance.

item.title: Jaishankar to represent India at Donald Trump’s swearing-in as US President - The Indian Express
item.description:
Jaishankar to Represent India at Donald Trump’s Swearing-in Ceremony

Publication Date: January 12, 2025
Source: Indian Express

External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar will attend Donald Trump’s swearing-in ceremony on January 20, as confirmed by the external affairs ministry.

  • Jaishankar will represent the Government of India at the event.
  • The event is organized by the Trump-Vance Inaugural Committee.
  • He will also hold meetings with members of the incoming administration and other dignitaries.
  • Jaishankar previously met NSA designate Mike Waltz during a visit in late December.
“EAM will also have meetings with representatives of the incoming Administration, as also some other dignitaries visiting the US on that occasion.”

This significant visit highlights India's diplomatic engagement with the United States and the importance of the upcoming administration.

item.title: Kerala Lottery Results 12.01.2025: Akshaya AK-685 Winners Declared; Full List Here! - News18
item.description:
Kerala Lottery Results Today: Here's FULL LIST of winning numbers for Akshaya AK-685 lucky draw for Sunday, January 12, 2025.

Last Updated: January 12, 2025, 21:28 IST

The Kerala State Lottery Department has announced the results for the Akshaya AK-685 lottery with significant prizes awarded. The first prize winner receives Rs 70 lakh, while second and third prizes are Rs 5 lakh and Rs 1 lakh, respectively. The winning numbers include:

  • First Prize: AB 846639 (Payyannur)
  • Second Prize: AH 243577 (Kottayam)
  • Third Prizes: AA 196854, AB 838400, AC 745225, AD 622450, AE 129668, AF 115526, AG 659827, AH 715095, AJ 303880, AK 692810, AL 579215, AM 889232.

Winning numbers for the consolation prize of Rs 8,000 are also listed. For those wishing to check their tickets, the results can be confirmed at www.keralalottery.info.

item.title: Delhi polls: Congress announces scheme for unemployed youth, promises ₹8500 per month - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Elections: Congress Unveils 'Yuva Udaan Yojana' for Unemployed Youth

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Congress party has announced the 'Yuva Udaan Yojana' scheme to provide ₹8,500 monthly for one year to unemployed youth in Delhi, contingent on their election victory.

  • The scheme targets educated yet unemployed youth.
  • Beneﬁciaries are required to demonstrate their skills through work placements.
  • This initiative is part of a broader campaign including the 'Pyari Didi Yojana' and 'Jeevan Raksha Yojana'.
  • Polling for Delhi assembly elections is set for February 5, 2025.
“We will provide financial assistance to youths who can show their skills in a company, factory or organisation.” - Sachin Pilot

The announcement signifies the Congress's attempt to regain influence in a region where they have not held power since 2013.

item.title: 'Yuva Udaan Yojana': Congress promises Rs 8,500 to educated unemployed youth in Delhi - The Times of India
item.description:
‘Yuva Udaan Yojana’: Congress promises Rs 8,500 to educated unemployed youth in Delhi

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Not provided

This article discusses the Congress Party's proposed initiative to provide financial support of Rs 8,500 to educated unemployed youth in Delhi through the 'Yuva Udaan Yojana'. This initiative aims to tackle unemployment among the youth in the region.

  • The Yuva Udaan Yojana aims to support educated unemployed youth in Delhi.
  • Congress promises a financial assistance of Rs 8,500 to eligible applicants.
  • The initiative intends to address the rising unemployment rates among young graduates.
  • Officials from Congress stated that this will empower youth and promote self-sufficiency.
“This initiative is our commitment to uplift the youth and offer them the support they need to thrive.”

The Yuva Udaan Yojana represents a significant step towards addressing youth unemployment, highlighting the need for government intervention in the job market.

item.title: Hyderabad roads wear deserted look ahead of Sankranti - Deccan Chronicle
item.description:
Hyderabad roads wear deserted look ahead of Sankranti

Date: January 12, 2025

Source: Deccan Chronicle

Hyderabad experienced a quiet morning as many residents traveled to their hometowns for the Sankranti festival, leading to almost empty streets.

  • Sultan Bazaar, usually bustling, was nearly deserted.
  • On Saturday evening, bus depots, railway stations, and toll plazas were crowded with people heading home.
  • Videos of heavy traffic filled social media.
  • The Telangana Government announced a week-long holiday for school students from January 11 to 17.
  • Authorities advised residents to secure their homes and avoid sharing travel plans on social media.
“The police authorities are urging citizens to follow precautionary measures and shift their valuables to a bank or a safer location, while they leave their house.”

The pre-festival rush has made the city streets deserted, showcasing the significance of the Sankranti holiday.

item.title: Tamil Nadu governor reacts to MK Stalin's ‘childish’ jibe: ‘Arrogance’ - Hindustan Times
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: US Consulate in Bengaluru: Site dedication ceremony on January 17 - Moneycontrol
item.description:
US Consulate in Bengaluru: Site Dedication Ceremony Set for January 17

Date: January 12, 2025 / 14:11 IST

Source: Moneycontrol

In a significant development, a site dedication ceremony for the US Consulate in Bengaluru is scheduled for January 17, aimed at supporting techies, business visitors, and students.

  • The ceremony will take place at JW Marriott on Vittal Mallya Road at 9:30 AM.
  • Temporary operations may commence at JW Marriott before a more extensive campus is established.
  • Visa issuance is expected to start a few months post-ceremony.
"The ceremony marks a long-standing demand in the region," - Moneycontrol.

This event signifies a move towards improved consular services in Bengaluru, meeting the needs of an expanding population of US nationals and businesses.

item.title: Telangana to issue new ration cards to eligible from Jan 26 - The Siasat Daily
item.description:
Telangana to Issue New Ration Cards Starting January 26

Date: January 10, 2024
Source: Siasat Daily

The government of Telangana will start issuing new ration cards from January 26, 2024. Beneficiaries will be identified through a verification process scheduled between January 16 and 20.

  • New ration cards will be issued as per previous eligibility rules; no new criteria have been established.
  • Applications for new ration cards and Indiramma housing will be accepted.
  • Priority will be given to families with land in Hyderabad for housing schemes.
  • Multiple initiatives including Rythu Bharosa and Indiramma Atmiya Bharosa will be launched on January 26.
  • 18.32 lakh individuals have been identified through the Indiramma app for housing assistance.
“Our goal is to build houses for all homeless families.” - Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy

The initiative aims to ensure that all eligible families receive support and assistance, reinforcing the government’s commitment to social welfare.

item.title: BJP will demolish all slums if it comes to power in Delhi, says Arvind Kejriwal - The Hindu
item.description:
Kejriwal Accuses BJP of Planning Slum Demolitions if Elected in Delhi

Date: January 12, 2025
Source: The Hindu

Arvind Kejriwal, leader of AAP, claims that if BJP gains power in Delhi, slum clusters will be demolished immediately post-election.

  • Kejriwal states that BJP has plans to demolish all slums quickly and warns slum dwellers against voting for the party.
  • He challenges Home Minister Amit Shah to withdraw cases against slum dwellers and resettle those evicted, or he will contest the elections.
  • Kejriwal criticizes BJP’s 'Jahan Jhuggi Wahan Makaan' scheme, describing it as ineffective.
  • The Delhi Assembly elections are set for February 5, with results on February 8.
“If Delhi’s slum dwellers give their vote to the BJP, it’ll be like signing off on your own suicide.” - Arvind Kejriwal

This statement highlights the urgency of upcoming Delhi elections and the significant concerns regarding slum housing policies.

item.title: J-K higher reaches likely to receive snow on Jan 16, says MeT - Greater Kashmir
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Mahakumbh 2025: Underwater drones, AI cameras, NSG commandos part of security detail; over 45 crore visitors expected - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mahakumbh 2025: Underwater drones, AI cameras, NSG commandos part of security detail; over 45 crore visitors expected

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Mahakumbh, the world’s largest religious gathering, is set to take place in Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh, from January 13 to February 26, 2025, with over 45 crore visitors expected. Extensive security arrangements are in place to ensure the safety of all participants.

Key Points:

  • A circular security system with 102 checkpoints has been established along seven critical routes.
  • Over 1,000 police personnel are deployed to manage security.
  • Comprehensive measures include 10 drones, 5 Vajra vehicles, and specialized teams for surveillance.
  • Advanced technology, including 2,700 AI cameras and 113 underwater drones, will monitor the event.
  • Mock drills were conducted with the NSG, ATS, and PAC to ensure preparedness.
“The Uttar Pradesh Police is committed to ensuring the safety of all participants,” said DGP Prashant Kumar.

The Mahakumbh is expected to attract millions to the Sangam, where the main bathing rituals will occur during auspicious dates. Enhanced security measures will help ensure a safe and orderly event.

item.title: 3 Maoists killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur, weapons and explosives recovered - The Times of India
item.description:
3 Maoists Killed in Encounter in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur, Weapons and Explosives Recovered

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

This article reports on an encounter in Bijapur, Chhattisgarh, where three Maoist militants were killed by security forces. Weapons and explosives were recovered from the site, indicating an ongoing struggle against Maoist insurgency in the region.

  • Three Maoists were killed in the encounter.
  • The incident took place in Bijapur, Chhattisgarh.
  • Significant amount of weapons and explosives were recovered.
  • The operation highlights the ongoing conflict with Maoist groups in India.
“Our forces are committed to maintaining peace and security in the region.”

This encounter underscores the intensifying efforts of security forces to combat Maoist activities in Chhattisgarh.

item.title: 'Never wanted INDIA bloc to dissolve': Sena UBT after deciding to go solo for local polls - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Never wanted INDIA bloc to dissolve: Sena UBT after deciding to go solo for local polls

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Shiv Sena (UBT) has decided to contest the upcoming Maharashtra local body polls independently, with Sanjay Raut emphasizing that he never sought the dissolution of the opposition INDIA bloc. This decision emerges amidst concerns of organizational growth and an opportunity for workers.

  • Shiv Sena (UBT) to field candidates in local body elections alone.
  • Sanjay Raut clarifies that he never called for the dissolution of the INDIA bloc or MVA alliance.
  • The need for opportunities for all members of the alliance highlighted.
  • The recent political dynamics include a split in support among alliance partners in Maharashtra.
  • The local elections aim to bolster the party's grassroots connections.
“My party or I have never said that the INDIA bloc or the MVA should be dissolved.” - Sanjay Raut

This decision reflects the ongoing shifts in Maharashtra's political landscape, as local elections are seen as pivotal for strengthening party foundations amid existing alliances.

item.title: ‘Great leadership of our PM Modi…’: Conman Sukesh declares overseas income of ₹7,640 crore, offers to pay tax - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Sukesh Chandrashekar Declares ₹7,640 Crore Overseas Income, Appeals to Pay Tax

Date: Jan 12, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Sukesh Chandrashekar, a conman arrested for fraud, has declared an overseas income of ₹7,640 crore and expressed his desire to pay taxes and contribute to India's development under PM Modi's leadership.

  • Sukesh appeals to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman regarding his declared income.
  • His businesses include online gaming operations based in Nevada and the British Virgin Islands.
  • He emphasizes the legitimacy of his income, claiming he is an undertrial and has not been convicted.
  • Sukesh aims to settle pending tax proceedings and invest in India's growth.
“As of today, being a proud Indian, under the great leadership of our Prime Minister Modi Ji, I want to contribute my part towards the world class development of this great nation... declaring my legitimate overseas income of ₹7,640 Crores for the year 2024.”

This declaration comes amidst ongoing legal troubles, but Sukesh asserts the legality of his income and his commitment to taxation.

item.title: Delhi elections: CM Atishi launches crowdfunding campaign ahead of Kalkaji contest - The Times of India
item.description:
Delhi Elections: CM Atishi Launches Crowdfunding Campaign for Kalkaji

Publication Date: [Insert Date]Source: [Insert Source]

Chief Minister Atishi of Delhi has initiated a crowdfunding campaign aimed at boosting her upcoming electoral contest in Kalkaji. This innovative approach is expected to engage the public and foster community support ahead of the elections.

  • Atishi aims to raise funds through public contributions.
  • The campaign seeks to increase voter engagement and support for her candidacy.
  • This move is part of a broader strategy to connect with constituents.
“We are reaching out to the public to empower them in the electoral process,” said Atishi.

This campaign marks a significant moment in Delhi politics, emphasizing grassroots support and community involvement.

item.title: EAM Jaishankar to represent India for Donald Trump’s inauguration in US on January 20 - The Hindu
item.description:
EAM Jaishankar to Represent India at Trump's Inauguration on January 20

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: The Hindu

External Affairs Minister Dr. S. Jaishankar will represent the Government of India at U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration ceremony on January 20, 2025. This follows an invitation from the Trump-Vance Inaugural Committee.

  • Jaishankar will attend the swearing-in ceremony as the 47th President of the USA.
  • He has held previous engagements with U.S. officials, discussing bilateral ties and global issues.
  • India seeks to explore hosting President Trump during the upcoming Quad leaders summit.
“On the invitation of the Trump-Vance Inaugural Committee, External Affairs Minister, Dr. S. Jaishankar will represent the Government of India at the Swearing-in Ceremony of the President-Elect Donald J. Trump as the 47th President of the United States of America.” — Randhir Jaiswal (@MEAIndia)

This visit is significant for India-U.S. relations as various topics, including visa processes and economic ties, are expected to be discussed during Jaishankar's meetings in the U.S.
